pullRequest.body:
Remove `Option.rel` and `Option.maybe`, which have identical definitions to `Option.Rel` and `Option.sequence`, and aren't used anywhere.

---
<!--

using the following format:

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body:
Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7290609170/job/19867783810)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7290609170/job/19867783593)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7290609170/job/19867783365)
You should keep this line, but with `Rel` on the RHS.
You see, I thought that, but there's another file in Mathlib.Init that *already does this*.
cc @digama0, I thought #align was supposed to prevent a single lean3 def having multiple lean4 alignments like this.

It does, but the check only runs when you write the command, not at `import` time, meaning that if you have two files that don't import each other then you can end up with overlapping alignments. (And we can't check at import time without losing the `Thunk RenameMap` optimization)
Would you rather have it in here or in the other file?
@digama0, is it easy to write a test that checks for duplicates in CI?

> Would you rather have it in here or in the other file?

The other file is fine.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - fix(Data/Option/Defs): Remove `Option.rel` and `Option.maybe`, superceded by std4
